data.title: The 65+ Best Movies With Space in the Title
data.meta_description: Over 70 filmgoers have voted on the 65+ Best Movies With Space in the Title. Current Top 3: Gayniggers from Outer Space, 2001: A Space Odyssey, Space Cowboys ...
data.text:
Ranked By

409 votes

74 voters

Voting Rules

Vote up your favorite movie with space in the name.

Have you ever noticed how many movies there are with space in the name? From cinema classics like 2001: A Space Odyssey to cult favorites like Space Jam with Michael Jordan, this list ranks the best movies with space in the title, regardless of genre or rating. What is your favorite movie with space in the name? This is kind of an odd way to categorize movies, but that's also why it's so fun! There are probably one or two movies with space in the title that you instantly think of, but you might be surprised how many others there are too as you scroll through this list.

This ranked poll of films with space in the title includes movies like Office Space and Killer Klowns From Outer Space. Don't forget that this list is interactive, meaning you can vote the film names up or down depending on much you liked each movie that has the word space in it.

Latest additions: Space Cadet

Over 70 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 65+ Best Movies With Space in the Title

Morten Lindberg, Gbartokai Dakinah, Gerald F. Hail

This controversial and deliberately provocative short film satirizes elements of both science fiction and blaxploitation genres. By employing the use of purposely offensive humor and absurdity, the film challenges viewers to confront and question their own prejudices and preconceptions. The film's unapologetically outrageous content has made it a subject of significant debate amidst its cult following.

Released : 1992

Directed by : Morten Lindberg

Director Stanley Kubrick's groundbreaking sci-fi masterpiece delves into themes of evolution, artificial intelligence, and extraterrestrial life. With its awe-inspiring visual effects and unique narrative style, the film invites viewers to embark on a thought-provoking journey through space and time. Its influence on science fiction cinema remains unparalleled, as it continues to challenge and fascinate audiences with its exploration of humanity's place in the universe.

Released : 1968

Directed by : Stanley Kubrick

Also ranks # 106 on The 200+ Best Psychological Thrillers Of All Time

Also ranks # 699 on The Most Rewatchable Movies

Also ranks # 27 on The Best Alien Movies Of All Time, Ranked

Clint Eastwood, Tommy Lee Jones, Donald Sutherland

This action-packed adventure unites an ensemble cast of Hollywood icons, including Clint Eastwood, Tommy Lee Jones, Donald Sutherland, and James Garner, as retired astronauts tasked with a critical mission to prevent a satellite from causing catastrophic damage. Balancing engaging action sequences with character-driven drama, the film explores themes of age, teamwork, and redemption. Its thrilling space-set climax and emotional core make it an exhilarating and heartfelt cinematic experience.

Released : 2000

Directed by : Clint Eastwood

Also ranks # 28 on The Best Movies Starring Clint Eastwood

Also ranks # 11 on The Best Movies About Astronauts & Realistic Space Travel

Also ranks # 9 on 18 Outer Space Movies That Even Non-Space Nerds Can Love

A delightful family-friendly adventure that centers around a telepathic extraterrestrial feline who crash-lands on Earth. With the help of human scientists and an amusing cast of characters, the cat must outwit government agents and fix his spaceship in order to return home. The film's charming humor, fun special effects, and whimsical premise make it an endearing classic for all ages.

Released : 1978

Directed by : Norman Tokar

Also ranks # 188 on The Best Kids Movies Of All Time

Also ranks # 87 on The Best Animal Movies Of All Time, Ranked

Also ranks # 15 on The Best Disney Movies Starring Cats

Jeffrey Tambor, F. Murray Abraham, Rob Schneider

In this lighthearted entry in the beloved Muppets franchise, viewers get a hilarious glimpse into Gonzo's origin story as he discovers his roots as an alien from outer space. Combining the signature Muppets wit with quirky interstellar adventure, the film is an entertaining romp filled with memorable songs and infectious laughter. The movie's blend of humor, heart, and zany extraterrestrial hijinks make it a cherished addition to the Muppets' oeuvre.

Released : 1999

Directed by : Tim Hill

An influential early entry in the sci-fi horror genre, this film follows a menacing alien creature that infiltrates a spaceship returning to Earth. The crew must band together to fight off the monstrous invader before it wipes them all out. Its claustrophobic atmosphere, suspenseful pacing, and expert storytelling have established it as a classic within the genre, inspiring numerous subsequent films.

Released : 1958

Directed by : Edward L. Cahn

Also ranks # 33 on The Greatest Classic Sci-Fi Movies
